div.div: While school buildings and facilities will remain closed through the end of the year, remote learning, student engagement and meal distribution will continue… read more

div.p: Working with Governor Justice and public health officials, the WVDE will continue to do what is best for the children of West Virginia. With the uncertainty caused by the pandemic, it is important for children and families to have hope that we will all get through this together. Additionally, the ongoing engagement by teachers who have been a consistent presence in the lives of our children for the past year is not only comforting to them but also necessary. Regardless of the extent of school closure, our professional and service personnel are committed to serving and supporting students and families through the end of the school year.

div.p: Though facilities are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, student engagement continues until the close of the academic calendar. Below you can find and submit resources for student engagement and remote learning.

div.p: Access remote learning resources and student engagement activities by grade level and instruction. Virtual and tech-free resources available.

div.class: fusion-column content-box-column content-box-column content-box-column-2 col-lg-4 col-md-4 col-sm-4 fusion-content-box-hover
col content-box-wrapper content-wrapper-background link-area-link-icon link-type-text icon-hover-animation-none

div.div: Access educator-curated resources for remote learning for students grades pre-k – 12. Educators can also submit activities, ideas, lessons, strategies and solutions.

div.div: Administrators can access resources and submit ideas on supporting staff and activities, lessons, strategies and solutions for student learning.
